element.Description: The record is active in the system
element.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
element.Name: Active

column.Description: The record is active in the system
column.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
column.Name: Active

element.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
element.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
element.Name: Search Key

column.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
column.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
column.Name: Search Key

element.Help: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.
element.Name: Name

column.Help: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.
column.Name: Name

element.Help: The Document Date indicates the date the document was generated. It may or may not be the same as the accounting date.
element.Name: Document Date

column.Help: The Document Date indicates the date the document was generated. It may or may not be the same as the accounting date.
column.Name: Document Date

element.Description: Document sequence number of the document
element.Help:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
element.Name: Document No

column.Description: Document sequence number of the document
column.Help:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
column.Name: Document No

element.Help: The Total Amount indicates the total document amount.
element.Name: Total Amount

column.ColumnSQL: (SELECT SUM(whl.TaxBaseAmt) FROM C_WHTaxTransLine whl WHERE whl.C_WHTaxTrans_ID = C_WHTaxTrans.C_WHTaxTrans_ID )
column.Help: The Total Amount indicates the total document amount.
column.Name: Total Amount

column.ColumnSQL: (SELECT SUM(whl.TaxAmt) FROM C_WHTaxTransLine whl WHERE whl.C_WHTaxTrans_ID = C_WHTaxTrans.C_WHTaxTrans_ID )
column.Name: Witholding Amount

The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you.
